reason.tex: %text If the number of possible outcomes is small, then it just might be easier to list them out first and count For example, the following is a good use-case for this approach \textit{In how many ways can one roll a total of $7$ using two dice?} But the following is perhaps not \textit{In how many ways is the following possible?} \[ \qquad a + b + c = 100\quad \left(a,b,c,\in\mathbb{N} \right)\] The number of potential outcomes is too large for one to count them all quickly and reliably by listing them out first%
